title: Display font – Shakespeare on power
content:
Hello,  
wondering what this font is called?  
Thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822183122im_/http:/typophile.com/files/shakespeare-on-power-book-cover-design_4429.jpg)
author: Emma-L

comments.content:
Sorry, I think this is hand lettered. There are too many variations in the identical letters. The serifs are not the same, the R legs are not the same, the W centers do not match. The O circles are not the same, etc.

- Mike Yanega

Agree hand lettered. For digital substitute you could try Charlemagne and similars [http://www.identifont.com/find?similar=charlemagne&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20140822183122/http:/www.identifont.com/find?similar=charlemagne&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?similar=charlemagne&q=Go")  
Don
